poem:
### Government's Song

A splintered sunrise,  
the Senate murmurs—  
a deal, a name etched  
in brittle ink.  
Eight hands clasped  
across the aisle,  
bridging silence with  
words not quite whole.  
Democracy, patched quilt,  
a fleeting echo  
of unity sewn  
in tomorrow's unrest.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Senate approves deal to end shutdown with Democrats riven by splits – US politics live 10.48am GMT You can find out how every Senator voted in the funding bill here: Related: How US senators voted on the shutdown-ending budget bill Updated at 10.48am GMT 10.26am GMT As we mentioned in the opening post, eight senators in the Democratic caucus worked with Republicans to craft the deal to reopen the US government. They were Senators Jeanne". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Senate approves deal to end shutdown with Democrats riven by splits – US politics live 10.48am GMT You can find out how every Senator voted in the funding bill here: Related: How US senators voted on the shutdown-ending budget bill Updated at 10.48am GMT 10.26am GMT As we mentioned in the opening post, eight senators in the Democratic caucus worked with Republicans to craft the deal to reopen the US government. They were Senators Jeanne
